item.title: Economic data in motion
item.description: if(!require("pacman")) install.packages("pacman") ## Loading required package: pacman p_load("tidyverse", "tidyquant", "gganimate", "bbplot") tickers <- c("LRHUTTTTFRM156S", "LRHUTTTTDEM156S", "LRHUTTTTUSM156S", "LRHUTTTTJPM156S") countries_name <- c("France", "Germany", "United States", "Japan") unemployment_lst <- list() for(i in seq_along(tickers)){ unemployment_lst[[i]] <- tq_get(tickers[i], get = "economic.data", from = "2000-01-01", to = "2018-11-01") %>% mutate(symbol = countries_name[i]) } unemployment_tbl <- do.

item.title: Road to oscars 2019
item.description: if(!require("pacman")) install.packages("pacman") p_load("tidyverse", "rvest", "bbplot", "ggalt") oscar_movies <- read_html("https://www.imdb.com/list/ls023438886/?st_dt=&mode=detail&page=1&ref_=ttls_vm_dtl&sort=list_order,asc") matrix_value <- matrix(0, nrow = 36, ncol = 4) colnames(matrix_value) <- c("movie_name", "date", "imdb_score", "metacritic_score") for(i in 1:36){ seudo_link <- "#main > div > div.lister.list.detail.sub-list > div.lister-list > div:nth-child" selector <- c("a", "span.lister-item-year.text-muted.unbold") for(j in 1:2){ matrix_value[i,j] <- oscar_movies %>% html_nodes(paste0(seudo_link,"(",i,") ","> div.

item.title: Technical Analysis With Plotly
item.description: if(!require("pacman")) install.packages("pacman") p_load("plotly", "quantmod") get data GSPC <- getSymbols("^GSPC",src='yahoo',auto.assign = FALSE, from = "2007-01-01") df <- data.frame(Date=index(GSPC),coredata(GSPC)) create Bollinger Bands bbands <- BBands(GSPC[,c("GSPC.High","GSPC.Low","GSPC.Close")]) join and subset data df <- subset(cbind(df, data.frame(bbands[,1:3])), Date >= "2015-01-01") colors column for increasing and decreasing for (i in 1:length(df[,1])) { if (df$GSPC.

item.title: Functional programming for mortals
item.description: Introduction Introduction this post has the intentionality to present briefly one of the property that exist in a ordinary square regression. if(!require("pacman")) install.packages("pacman") ## Loading required package: pacman p_load("tidyverse","gridExtra") set.seed(123) reps <- 10000 betas <- matrix(NA, nrow = reps, ncol = 2) beta0 <- 2 beta1 <- 2.
